what: Monitoring Overall Survival in Pivotal Trials in Indolent Cancers
title: Monitoring Overall Survival in Pivotal Trials in Indolent Cancers
text: guidelines meant provide pragmatic, yet rigorous, help drug developers decision makers, since shaped three fundamental ingredients: clinically determined margin detriment OS unacceptably high (δnull); benefit OS plausible given mechanism action novel intervention (δalt); quantity information (.e. events, expected number survival events, primary final analysis) feasible accrue given clinical drug development setting. proposed guidelines facilitate transparent discussions stakeholders focusing risks erroneous decisions might acceptable trade-power false positive error rate. Monitoring guidelines assume hazard ratio (HR) can adequately summarize size benefits harms experimental intervention vs control overall survival (OS). Furthermore, guidelines assume OS HR < 1 consistent beneficial effect intervention OS (smaller OS HRs <1 indicate increased efficacy). details OS monitoring guidelines formulated, please refer paper. find repository useful, please consider giving star! ⭐

title: Monitoring Overall Survival in Pivotal Trials in Indolent Cancers

code: library(monitOS) # Example 01: OS monitoring guideline retrospectively applied to Motivating Example 1 # with delta null = 1.3, delta alt = 0.80, gamma_FA = 0.025 and  beta_PA = 0.10. >>> title: Bounds — bounds
text: OS monitoring guidelines proposed manuscript "Monitoring Overall Survival Pivotal Trials Indolent Cancers". Calculate thresholds positivity can used analysis judge whether emerging evidence effect treatment OS concerning . threshold positivity given analysis value observed hazard ratio must order provide sufficient reassurance effect OS reach selected unacceptable level detriment (margin hr_null). Terminology follows manuscript "Monitoring Overall Survival Pivotal Trials Indolent Cancers"

title: Bounds — bounds
code: bounds(   events,   power_int = 0.9,   falsepos = 0.025,   hr_null = 1.3,   hr_alt = 0.9,   rand_ratio = 1,   hr_marg_benefit = NULL )

title: Bounds — bounds
text: events Vector. Target number deaths analysis power_int Scalar. Marginal power required Primary Analysis true hazard ratio (HR) hr_alt. falsepos Scalar. Marginal one-sided false positive error rate prepared tolerate Final Analysis. Determines positivity threshold Final Analysis hr_null Scalar. unacceptably large detrimental effect treatment OS want rule (HR scale) hr_alt Scalar. Plausible clinically relevant beneficial effect treatment OS (HR scale) rand_ratio Integer. patients randomized k:1 experimental intervention control, rand_ratio inputted k. Example: patients randomized 1:1 experimental control, k=1. patients randomized 2:1 experimental control, k=2. hr_marg_benefit Scalar. may uncertain plausible beneficial effect treatment OS . User can enter (HR scale) function evaluate probability meet positivity threshold analysis HR. second OS benefit usually closer 1 hr_alt.

title: Bounds — bounds
text: List contains: lhr_null: Scalar, unacceptable OS log-HR, lhr_alt: Scalar, plausible clinically relevant log-HR, lhr_pos: Scalar, positivity thresholds log-HR estimates, summary: Dataframe, contains: OS HR threshold positivity, One sided false positive error rate, Level 2 sided CI needed rule hr_null, Probability meeting positivity threshold hr_alt, Positivity_Thres_Posterior: Pr(true OS HR >= minimum unacceptable OS HR | current data), Positivity_Thres_PredProb: Pr(OS HR estimate Final Analysis <= Final Analysis positivity threshold | current data)

title: Bounds — bounds
text: Monitoring guidelines assume hazard ratio (HR) can adequately summarize size benefits harms experimental intervention vs control overall survival (OS). Furthermore, guidelines assume OS HR < 1 consistent beneficial effect intervention OS (smaller OS HRs <1 indicate increased efficacy).

what: Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior
title: Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior
text: .e. posterior probability true OS log-hr exceeds minimum unacceptable OS log-HR given estimate log-hr analysis k equals lhr_con.k (.e. estimate equal stage k 'continuation threshold').

title: Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior
Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior
text: lhr_con vector length K (# number looks OS data) containing 'continuation' thresholds log-HR scale lhr_null scalar - minimum unacceptable OS log-HR events vector length K - number OS events look data

title: Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior
text: vector length K - continuation thresholds expressed posterior probability scale

title: Function which calculates for k=1, ..., K, Pr(log-HR >= lhr_null | theta.hat.k = lhr_con.k) — calc_posterior

what: Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
title: Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
text: Calculates posterior predictive probability 'ruling ' lhr_null final OS analysis given current estimate OS log-HR lhr_cont_k, k=1, ..., K-1

title: Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
text: lhr_con vector length K (# number looks OS data) containing 'continuation' thresholds log-HR scale events vector length K - number OS events look data

title: Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
text: vector length K-1: continuation thresholds analyses k=1, ..., K-1 expressed scale posterior predictive probability ruling lhr_null final OS analysis

title: Calculate posterior predictive probability of ruling out lhr_null at final OS analysis — calc_predictive
code: lhr_con <- c(0.2, 0.15, 0.1) events <- c(100, 200, 300) calc_predictive(lhr_con, events)

title: Find Positivity Threshold — find_pos
text: function calculates positivity threshold based various criteria.

title: Find Positivity Threshold — find_pos
code: find_pos(pos_thld, events, rand_ratio, hr_null, hr_alt, which_crit, targ)

title: Find Positivity Threshold — find_pos
text: pos_thld Numeric. initial positivity threshold. events Numeric vector length 2. number events analysis. rand_ratio Numeric. randomization ratio. hr_null Numeric. hazard ratio null hypothesis. hr_alt Numeric. hazard ratio alternative hypothesis. which_crit Integer. criterion used finding positivity threshold: 1: False positive / False negative equals required value. 2: False positive / (False negative + False positive) equals required value. 3: False positive equals required value. 4: Predictive probability equals required value. targ Numeric. target value chosen criterion.

title: Find Positivity Threshold — find_pos
text: Numeric. calculated positivity threshold based specified criterion.

title: Find Positivity Threshold — find_pos
code: find_pos(   pos_thld = 1.5,   events = c(100, 200),   rand_ratio = 1,   hr_null = 1,   hr_alt = 1.5,   which_crit = 1,   targ = 0.05 ) #> [1] 1.907371

what: Probabilities of meeting positivity threshold under target HR — meeting_probs
title: Probabilities of meeting positivity threshold under target HR — meeting_probs
text: Probabilities meeting positivity threshold target HR

title: Probabilities of meeting positivity threshold under target HR — meeting_probs
Probabilities of meeting positivity threshold under target HR — meeting_probs
text: summary DataFrame. Summary dataframe bounds.R lhr_pos List. Log HRs positive threshold lhr_target Scalar. Target log HR calculate probability meeting positivity thresholds rand_ratio Integer. patients randomized k:1 experimental intervention control, rand_ratio inputted k. Example: patients randomized 1:1 experimental control, k=1. patients randomized 2:1 experimental control, k=2.

title: Probabilities of meeting positivity threshold under target HR — meeting_probs
text: Array. Probabilities meeting positivity threshold target HR

title: monitOS app — run_app
text: Runs shiny app guide user choice adequate settings calculate positivity thresholds monitor overall survival (OS)

title: monitOS app — run_app
text: return value, runs shiny app

title: monitOS 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-17 Changed Licence MIT. Added spell checking package. Added github issues link BugReport website link URL `Description. Fix import issue shiny dependency. Fix bug returning inf values Shiny app. Added new badges packages

title: monitOS 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-21 Improved DESCRIPTION, added website URL, screenshot Shiny app Improved README Improved code style using styler Fixed bug deploying Shiny app (relative import error) Fixed package coverage focusing statistical tool (shiny app)

title: monitOS 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-05 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added Shiny section README.md file. Improved monitOS::run_app(): new layout, new descriptions, new use case. Created pkgdown public website.

title: monitOS 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-31 Initial CRAN submission.
